Job Title: Multi-Craft Maintenance Tech Casting

Location: Birmingham, AL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Multi-Craft Maintenance-Casting 

Excellent opportunity to join a top 3 global automotive supplier. Excellent benefits, PTO, 401k, profit sharing and opportunities for growth. Don't miss this awesome opportunity.

PLC Troubleshooting & Repair Experience Required.

 Robotic maintenance experience required.

Casting Experience Preferred.

 Must be able to work any shift $26.88 – 36.45 per hour DOE Onsite only, no remote

PURPOSE OF POSITION:

To troubleshoot systems and perform preventive and predictive maintenance on various

equipment, while always keeping safety as a priority. Will also provide support for

production and carry out the assignments and responsibilities given to them by the

casting department maintenance supervisors and team leaders.

RESPONSIBILITY AND AUTHORITY:

Maintain, troubleshoot, and provide continuous improvement suggestions

resulting in minimal downtime of manufacturing equipment in the casting area. Support

installation and modification of equipment to ensure quality control requirements are met

and process enhancements are realized while creating a safe and healthful work place.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITIONS:

 Follow and enforce all plant safety rules and policies. Understand and promote company philosophies Follow and comply with all plant safety standards including LOTO Troubleshooting, diagnosis and repair of various manufacturing equipment,


including PLC, HMI’s, Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Robots, etc.

 Support continuous improvement, lean manufacturing processes and root cause


repair.

 Effective communication with team members and other departments. I.E. Down


time reports VIA email and shop logics.

 Maintain integrity of safety devices including light curtains, safety gates, barriers,


e-stops, guarding & fencing, etc.

 Assist in design and installation of new/improved manufacturing equipment,


components, and processes

 Make modifications to existing equipment as required. Assist in determining spare parts requirements Maintain accurate documentation Train operators and new team members on processes, TPM, PM, control panels,


etc.

 Assist employees with running lines, and how to use SOP, TWI, SW. Provide support for machine improvements. Ensure equipment meets NEC, OSHA, RIA, and Magna regulations Perform PM inspections as required, document issues and complete repairs Disassemble defective equipment as well as replaces defective parts, electrical,


mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic, etc.

 May specialize in repairing specific manufacturing equipment, and equipment that


is not specific to the manufacturing process.

 Use computerized or manual maintenance information systems to document the


details of equipment related issues, repairs made, preventative and predictive

maintenance measures taken, etc.

 Use computerize or manual systems to facilitate root cause analysis for failures


resulting in major downtime (as defined by management). Once the root cause

has been identified, put measurements in place that will prevent reoccurrence

within the affected business unit, as well as across the facility.

 Interface with all necessary production associates, production supervision, etc.,


to ensure issues are identified and resolved. In general, communicate with the

production team. Report and complete production leadership give tasks.

 Minimize downtime by effective use of resources including response time,


technical expertise, tools, spare parts and external contacts.

 Promote, monitor and maintain good housekeeping (5S) Working past shift end to complete tasks, breakdowns, improvements and pass


off necessary communication to leadership and or team members is required.

 Perform other duties as required.


Position Requirements-maintenance Technician

SKILL (Ability to do the job)

Must have good mathematical and communication skillsAbility to read and understand schematicsAbility to use testing and troubleshooting equipmentMust have a good understanding of rigging, cranes, etc.Must have a general knowledge of hydraulics and pneumaticsMust be able to pay good attention to detailMust have a basic knowledge of drafting (blueprint, dimension drawings, etc.)Basic knowledge of AUTOCADMust be able to work extended hours as needed to meet customer requirementsMust have basic knowledge or Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)Must have general knowledge on electrical theory and troubleshootingMust have general mechanical, electrical, welding, and mathematical knowledgeMust be able to work past shift end to pass off information or complete a task.Must be able to lift over 50lbs, stand for long periods and be positioned in


awkward areas to complete a task or break down.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Some of the physical demands for the position include being able to lift a

weight of 50 pounds; frequent bending, stooping and stretching; being able

to stand for prolonged periods of time; and ability to walk for prolonged

periods of time.

EQUIPMENT / TOOLS USED

Some of the equipment and tools used are a multi-meter, basic hand tools, punch tools,

Oscilloscope, laptop/PC, AMP probe, Mega ohm meter, MIG & Stick Welder, 5’s.

EDUCATION:

High School Diploma or GED required; 2-year degree from a technical college or minimum of

three years on-the-job training with heavy industrial manufacturing facility in skilled trade

capacity.

MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN-General knowledge of industrial maintenance with an emphasis

on electrical, mechanical, robotics, or controls application

OTHER: Journeyman Certification preferred

Work Experience Multi Craft Maintenance Techician

Maintenance experience in a manufacturing environment preferred

Minimum of 4 years

WHAT ADDITIONAL SKILLS OR ABILITIES WOULD BE HELPFUL FOR THE JOB?

Motor Control, PLC, and Ladder LogicBasic Electrical Theory and troubleshootingBasic knowledge of electrical componentsBasic understanding of services and variable frequency drivesWelding experienceApplicable rules, regulations and/or policies and procedures.Robotic troubleshooting & programming skillsPLC troubleshooting skills, ladder logic function and output condition understanding.High level of mechanical aptitudeMathematical Skills (work well with probability and statistical inference, and


fundamentals of plain and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts

such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations).

PM, TPM, Root cause analysis, downtime reporting/analysisReasoning Ability (Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw conclusions.


Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form

and deal with several abstract and concrete variables).

WHAT AREAS OF TRAINING ARE REQUIRED?

New Hire Orientation, OSHA Required Safety, Product and Process Overview,

Understanding the Charter, Lean Manufacturing Overview, 5S & Visual Management,

Basic Robot, Basic and Intermediate Allen Bradley PLC, Resistance Welding, Magna

Ethics & Compliance

HOW IS THE POSITION RELEVANT TO ACHIEVING QUALITY OBJECTIVES?

The Casting Multi-craft Technician is responsible for troubleshooting, preventive maintenance

and predictive maintenance required to ensure that equipment produces consistent quality parts.

The technician is also required to monitor and provide information on their assigned equipment

for improvement of throughput and quality, while creating a safe and healthful work place.

Other Pertinant Or Relevant Information

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be

performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to

follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties

requested by their manager, supervisors, and team leaders.

#onsite

Experience Level (if available): Associate
